meanings.definition: To right (a capsized vessel) by means of a system of cables and winches.
meanings.sent1: The sailors worked together to parbuckle the overturned boat back to its original position.
meanings.sent2: They used parbuckling to rescue the stranded sailors from the capsized ship.
meanings.sent3: The parbuckling process looked like a giant puzzle being solved at sea.
meanings.sent4: With precision and strength, they parbuckled the ship as if turning back time.
meanings.sent5: The image of parbuckling the ship became a symbol of teamwork and determination.

meanings.definition: The act of righting a capsized vessel using a system of cables and winches.
meanings.sent1: The successful parbuckling of the ship was a remarkable feat of maritime engineering.
meanings.sent2: After the parbuckling, the vessel was ready to sail again, thanks to the skilled crew.
meanings.sent3: The parbuckling operation turned into a spectator event as people cheered for the upright ship.
meanings.sent4: In the history of maritime disasters, the parbuckling of this ship stood out as a triumph.
meanings.sent5: The importance of parbuckling in maritime emergencies cannot be overstated.
